text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly identifies and quotes Article 9(5) of the Convention, stating: 'More critically, Article 9(5) provides that when an authorized officer has reason to believe a vessel is not complying with Convention provisions, the officer \"may identify the vessel, seek to obtain the necessary information from the vessel and report.\"' This directly satisfies the requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "criterion 3"}
